trans-unit.source: Scheduler
trans-unit.target: Scheduler

trans-unit.source: The Scheduler provides an interface to register and manage recurring or one-time tasks.
trans-unit.target: The Scheduler provides an interface to register and manage recurring or one-time tasks.

trans-unit.source: The Scheduler uses a single cron job to handle all registered tasks. It is thus very convenient as only one cron job needs to be set up and all task frequencies can be managed from the BE module.
trans-unit.target: The Scheduler uses a single cron job to handle all registered tasks. It is thus very convenient as only one cron job needs to be set up and all task frequencies can be managed from the BE module.

trans-unit.source: Class of the task
trans-unit.target: Class of the task

trans-unit.source: Choose a class from the list of available tasks
trans-unit.target: Choose a class from the list of available tasks

trans-unit.source: Some tasks are provided by the TYPO3 Core itself. Others come from extensions. See the manual to learn how to create your own tasks and register them with the Scheduler.
trans-unit.target: Some tasks are provided by the TYPO3 Core itself. Others come from extensions. See the manual to learn how to create your own tasks and register them with the Scheduler.

trans-unit.source: Disable task
trans-unit.target: Disable task

trans-unit.source: Check this box to disable the automatic, scheduled execution of this task. It can still be launched manually from the BE module.
trans-unit.target: Check this box to disable the automatic, scheduled execution of this task. It can still be launched manually from the BE module.

trans-unit.source: Type of task
trans-unit.target: Type of task

trans-unit.source: Choose whether the task must happen a single time or will be repeated
trans-unit.target: Choose whether the task must happen a single time or will be repeated

trans-unit.source: Start of task
trans-unit.target: Start of task

trans-unit.source: Enter a start date and time for the task
trans-unit.target: Enter a start date and time for the task

trans-unit.source: Date must be entered in a standard format like HH:mm dd-mm-YYYY or YYYY-mm-dd HH:mm. Natural keywords can also be used, like "now" or "tomorrow". Date and time must correspond to the server's time zone.
trans-unit.target: Date must be entered in a standard format like HH:mm dd-mm-YYYY or YYYY-mm-dd HH:mm. Natural keywords can also be used, like "now" or "tomorrow". Date and time must correspond to the server's time zone.

trans-unit.source: End of task
trans-unit.target: End of task

trans-unit.source: Enter an end date and time for the task, can be blank
trans-unit.target: Enter an end date and time for the task, can be blank

trans-unit.source:
Date must be entered in a standard format like HH:mm dd-mm-YYYY or YYYY-mm-dd HH:mm. Natural keywords can also be used, like "now" or "tomorrow". Date and time must correspond to the server's time zone.
Can be left blank, if task is not supposed to end at any point.
trans-unit.target:
Date must be entered in a standard format like HH:mm dd-mm-YYYY or YYYY-mm-dd HH:mm. Natural keywords can also be used, like "now" or "tomorrow". Date and time must correspond to the server's time zone.
Can be left blank, if task is not supposed to end at any point.

trans-unit.source: Frequency of task
trans-unit.target: Frequency of task

trans-unit.source: Enter a frequency, either in seconds or using a cron-like syntax (minutes, hours, day of month, months and day of week)
trans-unit.target: Enter a frequency, either in seconds or using a cron-like syntax (minutes, hours, day of month, months and day of week)

trans-unit.source:
The frequency of the task can be simply entered as a number of seconds.
Alternatively it is possible to use the same syntax as for cron jobs. This is simply a list of five numbers or the wildcard "*", separated by blanks. The five numbers are (in order) minutes, hours, day of month, months and day of week. Examples:
*/5 * * * * means every 5 minutes 30 22 * * * means every day at 22:30
The Scheduler supports the full cron syntax.
trans-unit.target:
The frequency of the task can be simply entered as a number of seconds.
Alternatively it is possible to use the same syntax as for cron jobs. This is simply a list of five numbers or the wildcard "*", separated by blanks. The five numbers are (in order) minutes, hours, day of month, months and day of week. Examples:
*/5 * * * * means every 5 minutes 30 22 * * * means every day at 22:30
The Scheduler supports the full cron syntax.

trans-unit.source: Wikipedia reference|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cron
trans-unit.target: Wikipedia reference|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cron

trans-unit.source: Multiple executions
trans-unit.target: Multiple executions

trans-unit.source: Choose whether a task can be running several times simultaneously or not
trans-unit.target: Choose whether a task can be running several times simultaneously or not

trans-unit.source: Email address
trans-unit.target: Email address

trans-unit.source: Enter a recipient for the mails sent by the test task
trans-unit.target: Enter a recipient for the mails sent by the test task

trans-unit.source: Sleep time
trans-unit.target: Sleep time

trans-unit.source: Enter a number of seconds during which the task will just sleep.
trans-unit.target: Enter a number of seconds during which the task will just sleep.

trans-unit.source: Select backends
trans-unit.target: Select backends

trans-unit.source: If a cache uses one of the selected backends, the garbage collection will be called for this cache.
trans-unit.target: If a cache uses one of the selected backends, the garbage collection will be called for this cache.

trans-unit.source: Number of days
trans-unit.target: Number of days

trans-unit.source: Delete rows from selected table that are older than given number of days.
trans-unit.target: Delete rows from selected table that are older than given number of days.

trans-unit.source: Select table
trans-unit.target: Select table

trans-unit.source: Select one of the registered tables to be cleaned up with this task.
trans-unit.target: Select one of the registered tables to be cleaned up with this task.

trans-unit.source: Clean up all tables
trans-unit.target: Clean up all tables

trans-unit.source: If selected, all configured tables are cleaned. The selection below is ignored.
trans-unit.target: If selected, all configured tables are cleaned. The selection below is ignored.

trans-unit.source: Number of days
trans-unit.target: Number of days

trans-unit.source: Delete files in _recycler_ folders that are older than the given number of days.
trans-unit.target: Delete files in _recycler_ folders that are older than the given number of days.
